nodes.caption: Ohoh, got a #ticket for running a red light on my #bicycle... (As if that is the #police's main concern in Amsterdam...). It got funny when they wanted my official #address. The #confusion on the faces of the #officers was absolutely worth the €90 fine. Which I may or may not have to pay, depending if they can get the paper #ticket to me. NEW YORK : GRAND PARADE IN MANHATTAN CELEBRATES WORLD FALUN DAFA DAY,

May 13, 2017, marks the 25th #anniversary of Falun Dafa's introduction to the public and the 18th annual World Falun Dafa Day. Approximately 10,000 Falun Gong practitioners from across the globe gathered in New York to take part in a number of events to #celebrate this major milestone. A grand parade was held in #Manhattan on May 12.

The parade started from Dag Hammarskjöld Plaza near the United Nations #headquarters, marched through midtown-Manhattan, passed by Grand Central Terminal and Bryant Park, and terminated at the #Chinese #General #Consulate. The parade started at 9:30 a.m. and last for four hours. The route was about two miles in length.

Leading the #parade was one of three Tian Guo Marching Bands, followed by a #dragon #dance team comprised of New York-based practitioners. Behind them were practitioners carrying colorful banners, followed by motorized floats on which practitioners demonstrated the exercises, and #golden costume-clad practitioners beating #traditional tunes on red waist #drums.

New York Police Officer: Everyone Should Have Falun Dafa!

Three #police #officers on duty received hand-made lotus flowers from Falun Gong practitioners. Seeing the #delightful parade, they shouted, “Falun Dafa is good!” along with other spectators. Officer Anthony said, “Very good! Very nice! Everyone should have Falun Dafa!” Writer: The World Needs Such People :

Writer Erla was born in #Norway and now makes her home in New York. She watched the parade with her friend Teder. Erla said that she very much enjoyed the #music #accompanying the parade. She added that it was great to see so many people from different #countries taking part. She admired the practitioners' perseverance in striving to live by Dafa's principles of Truthfulness, Compassion, and Forbearance, and added that she wished that leaders of all countries would follow the principle.

Erla said she knew about the #persecution of Falun Gong in #China, and she felt it incredible that such a thing could occur nowadays. She said that other countries should help stop the persecution,( http://goo.gl/69SgrQ )

I am preparing a print for a client in Singapore whose friends live in a 'Black and White' as they are referred to locally. The #blackandwhite #colonial houses of Singapore are #heritage gems and were used to house officers of rank during the war. Land prices are at a premium now in Singapore but these plantation houses sit inland with mango and rambutan trees and ooze the charm of colonial days #heritagearchitecture #singapore #singaporeart #singaporeexpat #singaporeart #singaporearchitecture #wartime #colonial #officers #historicalhouses #blackandwhitetour #blackandwhitehouse
#officers

"At Least 32 #Rohingya #Women And #Girls Raped By #Myanmar Military And Border Guard Police In #Buthidaung" - RB News

Buthidaung, #Arakan – In the last week, at least 32 Rohingya women and girls were raped by Myanmar military and Border Guard Police. This happened in Kyaung Taung village tract, northern side of Taung Bazar village in Buthidaung Township of Arakan State.

On May 6th, 2017 a group consisting of 300 #military and border guard police suddenly entered into Kyaung Taung village tract and #besieged the village. Then they checked house by house. While doing so, men were detained and beaten. The women and girls were taken out of the houses and were forced to line up. Then, the #soldiers and police #molested them and robbed whatever they found on the women's bodies such as gold and money. They took away any gold and money, whatever valuables that they found. They destroyed food, household and kitchen wears, according to the villagers.

Again on May 8th, 2017 a group of border guard police from Taung Bazar regional camp and Kyaung Taung village and another group of soldiers from Light #Infantry Unit 552 and 232 collaborated together and entered into Middle hamlet and Sar Kine hamlet of Kyaung Taung village tract.

Once the troops entered, and as the villagers already experienced the attacks on May 6th, all men and two thirds of the women escaped from the village immediately. The troops robbed from every house and destroyed whatever they couldn't carry with them. According to the villagers, they raped many women and girls till May 11th, 2017.

The villagers said border guard police officers Ko Ko Oo and Maung Maung Htay specifically, have #raped many women and girls. Among them, two women were gang raped. All of them reported about the #sexual #violence to the high ranking #officers of the military and #border #guard police based nearby their village.

They have said on May 9th, 7 women and girls from Middle hamlet, on May 10th, 16 women and girls from Sar Kine hamlet and on May 11th, 9 women and girls from Middle hamlet were raped.

Report contributed by MYARF.

I love seeing the White House all lit up in blue for us. My sincerest thanks to President Donald R. Trump for recognizing Police Officer's Memorial Day on May 15, 2017 by illuminating the White House in blue lights. It used to be something only my police family was aware of, but tonight my neighbor/friend Danny and his wife came over to wish me well during this time. I was shocked that he knew, but then remembered President Trump's Proclamation was covered on the news Monday. It feels good to have people observe this week with us as I remember several of my friends who were killed or disabled in the line of duty along with too many others across the United States. Service, sacrifice and loss bond all of us who wear the badge no matter who we are or where we are from. I am proud of our occupation and the countless selfless officers who continue to serve regardless the cost. 👮🏻👮🏻‍♀️For my friends Joey Cushman-Arlington PD, Hank Nava-Fort Worth PD, Lisa Ramsey, Richard Lambing, Cliff Hankins and Matt Pearce. #thinblueline #nationalpoliceweek2017 #officers

As we reflect on #NationalPoliceWeek and honor #officers who have died in the #lineofduty, KXAN's #FALLEN project examines the role mental health played leading to officers' murders and the necessary solutions that could prevent future deaths. 
Click into our #instastory to walk through the murder of Chief Lee Dixon.

Members from the Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department joined other agencies from around the country at the National Law Enforcement Officers Memorial this evening in Washington D.C. They came to honor their brothers and sisters who gave the ultimate sacrifice. The bond of this brotherhood and sisterhood is unlike any other. 
Photo Credit: Michelle Payne

This year 4 Regiment @armyaircorps have run the Potential Non Commissioned Officers cadre for all Army Air Corps units. The junior leaders put their newly learned skills into practise by engaging in a ground assault after being flown in by US V-22s as a part of Exercise Archers Pegasus in Norfolk

#Army #training #exercise #military #British #US #vehicles #planes #soldier #officers #team

Cavalrymen taking part in the 93rd Annual Parade and Service of The Combined #Cavalry Old Comrades Association at the Cavalry Memorial in #HydePark #London. The #parade remembers all those who have given their lives to conflict since the #FirstWorldWar. The traditional dress of #Bowler #hats, #suit and Regimental #tie, while carrying a furled #umbrella was the accepted walking out dress in 1920s London when the annual parade started.  Even today Household Division #Officers are expected to dress like this when on duty out of #uniform in the capital. Although now a stereotype of the #English #gentleman the bowler hat was worn by the working classes in the 19th century and the hat of choice for riders, like our #cavalrymen today - not only does it afford protection from low lying branches but doesn't blow off in the wind. #practicalclothing #medals #soldiers #military #fashion #whatareyouwearing #wheredidyougetthathat #hatsofinstagram #doff #british #britisharmy #style
